1471919870786818054.text: That is why I have introduced legislation that would increase access to DXA testing for Medicare beneficiaries and preserve Medicare reimbursement rates for DXA testing.

1471919869549588485.text: Advocates believe that hospitals and physician practices acquired by hospitals have decreased the number of DXA tests performed on Medicare beneficiaries because they lose money on the low reimbursement rate.

1471919868471652355.text: Medicare covers preventive scans, called DXA, to detect osteoporosis for women, and covers limited DXA scans for men. An important test needed before prescribing medications to treat osteoporosis.

1471919867360161802.text: Osteoporosis is responsible for approximately 300,000 hip fracture hospitalizations and almost two million broken bones per year, yet nearly 80 percent of older Americans who suffer bone breaks are not tested or treated for the disease.

Q: I am fully vaccinated and just traveled to an area with low vaccination rates, does that mean I have to get tested for COVID?
A: Even if you’re fully vaccinated, you should still wear a mask during your trip and get tested after visiting an area with low vaccination rates.

1420452021627457538.text:
Q: Do I need to wear a mask?
A: If you’re not vaccinated, the CDC recommends that you always wear a mask. If you’re fully vaccinated, the CDC recommends wearing masks indoors in COVID hotspots.

1420452019911991298.text:
Q: Will my vaccine (J&J, Moderna, or Pfizer) protect against the delta variant?
A: All vaccines have shown protections against symptomatic diseases and hospitalizations against the delta variant. If you’re not vaccinated, the delta variant can potentially be life-threatening.

1392122975567089664.text: This legislation would take a meaningful step in undoing the harmful legacy of past infrastructure projects that have hindered the economic development and mobility of disadvantaged communities. It also recognizes the importance of community engagement and planning.

1392122974447226888.text: By removing burdensome #transportation barriers, we can reconnect communities to opportunities, improve health and safety, and make daily life better. I'm proud to join @SenatorCarper in sponsoring the Reconnecting Communities Act, which do just that.

1392121300773130241.text: Rather than connecting their communities and expanding their opportunities, highway construction brought demolition, displacement, isolation, and exclusion. According to one estimate, the federal highway system, between 1956 and 1967, displaced more than 300,000 households.

1392121299783327745.text: Our national hwy system, built in the 1950s was a great achievement—a major public investment in infrastructure, transforming our country. We rely on it today. But for too many, especially communities of color, the construction of our hwys had traumatic and destructive impacts.

1392121298755674116.text: We are long overdue in taking hard look at how our federal #transportation policy can help address the challenge of inequity—the exclusion of disadvantaged communities and communities of color. Baltimore City is intimately familiar with this painful history of highway planning.

1091720402106146816.text: As we celebrate icons of #BlackHistoryMonth, let's not forget the unbelievable odds they overcame to take part in the American Dream, to assert their unalienable rights and to simply exist. Let's continue to speak their names as promises to build a brighter and more equal future.

1090355135082041344.text: Big thanks to @Alyssa_Milano for coming by to talk about how we can get the Equal Rights Amendment over the finish line. Equal protection under our Constitution isn’t a partisan issue — it’s a basic human rights one. Glad to have your support on this. Let’s get it done. #ERANow https://t.co/9Br92mFOU6

1090268635954765831.text: Couldn't agree more. Gender equality should be explicitly protected by our Constitution, and I'm proud to be working with you, @RepMaloney and @LisaMurkowski to get that done. Let's get the ERA across the finish line. #ERANow https://t.co/Amu1NUBtCJ

1089997059896295430.text: Thanks for all your work on this, @Alyssa_Milano. Looking forward to seeing you tomorrow to discuss how we can get the #ERA over the finish line. #ERANow https://t.co/cYxsXYTg2s

.@LisaMurkowski and I agree: women should not be provided fewer protections under the law because of their gender. This is a human rights issue, not a partisan one. Gender equality should be an explicit principle of our society — and our Constitution. #ERA
